description: Internal vendor identifier used to uniquely reference the supplier in purchasing, payables, and reporting.
Primary street address line for the supplier’s mailing or physical location.
Secondary address line (suite, building, PO Box, or additional routing details).
City for the supplier’s address.
State/province or region code for the supplier’s address; typically a two-letter postal abbreviation.
Postal or ZIP code for the supplier’s address; may include ZIP+4 or placeholders.
Primary telephone number for general contact with the supplier.
Primary contact person or department at the supplier for ordering or inquiries.
Tax classification code determining sales/use tax treatment for purchases; likely references a tax table; confirm with SME.
Default vendor discount (e.g., early-payment or price discount) applied on purchases; percentage or amount as configured; confirm unit with SME.
Short description of the supplier or the goods and services provided.
Fax number for the supplier.
Primary email address for the supplier; field may contain other contact info; confirm validation rules.
Internal satisfaction or performance rating for the supplier (e.g., 1–3 scale); confirm scoring method with SME.
Supplier’s website or online portal address.
After-hours or emergency contact name/attention line for the supplier; likely used for off-hours support; confirm with SME.
After-hours or emergency phone number for the supplier.
Supplier’s federal tax identification number (EIN/SSN) for compliance and reporting.
Supplier’s legal or display name used on purchasing and payables documents.
Default tax rate used for this supplier’s purchases; may be overridden by jurisdiction rules; confirm source and usage with SME.
Mobile phone number for the primary contact.
Indicates minority-owned or disadvantaged business status for supplier diversity reporting; likely coded flag; confirm values with SME.
Supplier status code controlling availability for transactions (e.g., Active, Closed); confirm code set with SME.
